description.raw:
This is related to issue #1311.

The code in GuiIface.cc doesn't work, because gazebo::client::addPlugin() calls gazebo_shared::addPlugin() which only supports system plugins. Same for gazebo_shared::setup(), it only supports system plugins and calls Load(argc,argv) and Init(argc,argv), which the GUIPlugin doesn't have.

The error described in issue #1311 happens because QApplication has to be created before the plugin is loaded (requirement by Qt). But in the current version of GuiIface.cc, the plugin is created too early in parse_args().

This PR fixes this issue. Now gzclient can be started with the -g parameter, e.g.

``gzclient -g <your-plugin-lib>.so``
description.html:
This is related to issue #1311.

The code in GuiIface.cc doesn't work, because gazebo::client::addPlugin() calls gazebo_shared::addPlugin() which only supports system plugins. Same for gazebo_shared::setup(), it only supports system plugins and calls Load(argc,argv) and Init(argc,argv), which the GUIPlugin doesn't have.

The error described in issue #1311 happens because QApplication has to be created before the plugin is loaded (requirement by Qt). But in the current version of GuiIface.cc, the plugin is created too early in parse_args().

This PR fixes this issue. Now gzclient can be started with the -g parameter, e.g.

gzclient -g <your-plugin-lib>.so

title.raw: Load GUI Plugins with gzclient parameter -g, fixes issue 1311

This is related to issue #1311.

The code in GuiIface.cc doesn't work, because gazebo::client::addPlugin() calls gazebo_shared::addPlugin() which only supports system plugins. Same for gazebo_shared::setup(), it only supports system plugins and calls Load(argc,argv) and Init(argc,argv), which the GUIPlugin doesn't have.

The error described in issue #1311 happens because QApplication has to be created before the plugin is loaded (requirement by Qt). But in the current version of GuiIface.cc, the plugin is created too early in parse_args().

This PR fixes this issue. Now gzclient can be started with the -g parameter, e.g.
